item.title: Hazard Course Remake
item.dc:creator: LarsBR
item.description:
dky.tehkingd.u:

I pretty much agree with this.

Where did these VMFs come from, anyway? Lars, did you actually take the time to make all of these?

Yup, I started that project a few years ago as a test in SDK 2009. That was on my old computer (from 2002) and it had trouble with shadowed textures in Hammer. Every missing texture was white - an even white. So I took some measures and made my own maps. But it is still a more or less direct adaptation of the old Hazard Course maps.

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course Remake
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
The original Hazard Course never had any tX or aX numbers, they were just 0 for all maps.

I say we take advantage of a different numbering system and use those tXaX numbers for something.

We could make aX stand for area, such as movement, shooting, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course Remake
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
So say t0a0 and t0a0a are merged. We name it “bm_t0a0a” because it’s the first map. Then t0a0b and t0a0c are merged, then that one’s called “bm_t0a0b” because it’s the second map.

It’s actually pretty simple. I know Black Mesa split the maps at different sections and they sticked close to the original map names without problem.

Ghost page fix’d, by the way.

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course Remake
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
The problem is, we can’t stick with the original names because we’re dividing the maps in different places…

EDIT: OT: NOOOO THE FIRST GHOST PAGE OF THIS THREAD

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course Remake
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
I’m pretty sure I sent out the info to those that don’t have it.

As for the naming, I think of it like this: cXaYZ, where X = Act (or day, I guess), Y = Chapter within act, and Z = map of chapter.

It’s pretty awkward, but works. C1a0 is Anom mats. Around the time night swings by (judging due to night just before Apprehension) it switches to c2a1 (Blast Pit), and…

Wait, wait, no, it doesn’t work.

Okay, no over-analyzing. It’s irrelevant for the most part. If we just stick to the original map names everything should be fine and dandy, we can all laugh and be happy, release a perfect add-on, go triple platinum in 7 hours and become rich and famous.

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course Remake
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
Team members, check your PMs (unless Crypt hasn’t sent the info out yet).

We are officially cutting the crap and organizing. We’ve been screwing around for far too long. Check with Crypt if he hasn’t sent the new info yet.

EDIT:

Does anyone know how the map naming scheme works? “bm_c1a5b” or whatever isn’t really descriptive. The numbers don’t seem to correspond to chapter or anything, really. Anyone have a better knowledge of how it works?

Read full topic

item.title: Hazard Course Remake
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
darkone:

some miner questions here

  1. will the hazard course at any point show the suit zoom?

  2. will there be multiple paths on the jsut walk area like there was on half life?

3.will there be a area that has you jumping from moving platforms? (as there isn’t really one in game)

  1. No idea, but anything is possible because no concepts as of now are final.

  2. I’d imagine it would be so, but no idea… see above

  3. There was one in the original (rotating platform), but again, see above

Read full topic
